GT.content: pièce & “title” could give the title to any possible discourse on gift, any possible gift
Baudelaire’s “Counterfeit Money,” its play w/ title, links literature to belief, credit, thus capital, economy, politics
a “true” corpus is still, perhaps, counterfeit money, may be ghost or spirit, spirit of body & of capital (title, heading, is capital), no problem of canon if this institution were natural

LOBL.content: Blanchot’s Death Sentence, “title runs wild and drives the reader mad”
[literary] title is not its own telos, not self-mirroring, writing prevents reflecting representation from folding back on itself

BL.content: “Before the Law” : the meta-structure of the title itself
title is part of literature but heterogeneous to text because of its legal authority
from title to incipit [re: Vor dem Gesetz], 2 moments, repetition, the same > dividing of letter, “it [the repetition itself] splits the boundary by dividing its line”

HASD.content: every title has the import of a promise

PAS.content: endless dissemination in Blanchot’s Le pas au-déla > just what, so some other thing, than what comes to the title as title

DS.content: title—capital: carries its head too high, raises its voice, drowns out ensuing text
what ruins the “pious capital letter,” the aplomb of the heading: the blanks, ordered return of white spaces, measure & order of dissemination, law of spacing, rhythmos, invisible fleuron

suspended lustre of title: title provides a first fold, highlights womb-like matrix of page, a germinal or seminal blank, “the perpetual suspense of a tear that can never be entirely formed nor fall (still the lustre) scintillates in a thousand glances”
graft/graph (both from graphion, writing implement, stylus) — bridge graft; capital title as scion/graft (can’t tell whether its present or absent anymore)

WAP.content: privilege of title, capital, capital letter, folded up (repliée): capitalizes its meanings in its folds: able to dispense w/ sentence, w/ making itself explicit > we should begin by decapitalizing (employ/deploy significations)
privilege from its unicity, its place > its privilege is legal & authorized
keeps quiet while making us think it has a lot to say

institution of title/work can be incarnated by people, even single person: but this incarnation guaranteed by some institution > institution guards, guarantees title, thus already holds title; origin of power to entitle/accredit can never be phenomenalized; this not merely circle makes us rethink “repression,” “suppression,” “sacrifice”
a community (being-with, being-together, meeting, gathering) always presupposed in word/concept “title”
title, titulus (inscription, certificates of genealogy), tiō, timaō (estimate, honor, valorize), timē (evaluation, estimate, price attached to someone, reward) or ci (connection)
title only has meaning virtual sentences (phrases) could give it, it gets its authority (both silent and intarissable) by capitalizing (summoning/repressing) on these virtualities
title: most artificial/deceitful place in language
the definite article in title “The Crisis in the Teaching of Philosophy” would mean one can identify it, legitimacy of a topos [but crisis is a problem of limits, borders, etc.]

DPi.content: w/out title, head (chef), capital: a text is an outlaw, decapitated (w/ neither head nor tail [PP p. 79])

PIO.content: [section heading: Patents (Brevets): Inventions of the Title]

PJP.content: the 3 meanings of Le Parjure, each haunts each other, raises the # of titles (3+n): 1) the novel itself [“Counterfeit Money”], narrator betrays truth confided in him 2) betrayal, unfulfilled promise of hero of novel 3) the legal perjury, le parjure committed by le parjure

C.content: when there’s # in the title: corrupts the authority of the name, voice, phonetic writing
cartouche: puts itself to work, forms part of the work by inscribing (itself) (as) the title, signature, autobiographical performative of the signatory
that which is entitled Cartouches is itself a series of cartouches, the title describes place, structure, form of text: voici des cartouches, ceux que je suis [follow/am] [cf. “Counterfeit Money”]
I am myself cartouche and cartouches(s) in the plural: “I” sign myself to death as soon as there’s the title, reduce myself to first heading, capital, shrunken head

ATAP.content: quoting title, a genre, genre making fun of a genre [re: Kant’s “Of an Overlordly Tone Recently Adopted in Philosophy”]

EU.content: Derrida believes in indestructibility of ordered procedures of legitimation, titles, diplomas

SPEC.content: fort/da: argument of spool, not a story, not a myth > to give it a title is to accredit the deposit, the investiture
under what headings (titres) can one say re: Ernst, Freud’s recalling himself? under several interlaced, serial headings (titres)

FV.content: mise en abyme of title [The Purloined…]: the text is the object
